title.narrative: Diakonia: Supporting People for a Dignified Life 2020-2024
Diakonia: Supporting People for a Dignified Life 2020-2024

description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Diakonia har inkommit med en ansökan om stöd från Sida på ett totalt belopp på SEK 110 000 000 för genomförande av sitt program "Supporting People for a Dignified Life" i Kambodja under perioden 2020-2024. Den gällande svenska strategin för utvecklingssamarbete med Kambodja är förlängd till och med 2020, och därför beslutar Sida att ingå avtal med Diakonia under fyra av programmets fem år, från och med 1 januari 2020 till 31 december 2023, med ett totalt bidrag av SEK 87 500 000.
Insatsen bygger på Diakonias tidigare erfarenheter och resultat av tidigare stöd. Insatsen syftar till att stärka det kambodjanska civilsamhället med kapacitet att utvidga det demokratiska utrymmet samt främja mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet så att människor i Kambodja kan leva fredliga, värdiga liv med tillgång till grundläggande rättigheter och friheter. Insatsen har ett speciellt fokus på kvinnor och jämställdhet samt på stöd till utsatta grupper i Kambodja.

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Diakonia has applied for funding from Sida with a total amount of SEK 110 000 000 to implement its programme entitled “Supporting People for a Dignified Life” in Cambodia during the period of 2020-2024. As the Swedish Strategy for development cooperation with Cambodia is extended to 2020, the Embassy therefore decides to grant support to Diakonia for a period of four years starting from 1 January 2020 to 31 December 2023, with the total amount of SEK 87 500 000.
Building on experiences and results from the previous programme, the new programme’s overall objective is “a strengthened civil society with the capacity to widen democratic space and promote human rights and gender equality so Cambodian people can lead peaceful, dignified lives with access to fundamental rights and freedoms”.

The development objective of the program from Diakonia’s context analysis is to contribute to a just, equal and sustainable Cambodia free from poverty, oppression, inequality and violence. The overall objective for the program is; A strengthened civil society with the capacity to widen democratic space and promote human rights and gender equality so Cambodian people can lead peaceful, dignified lives with access to fundamental rights and freedoms. The overall objective has four underlying objectives that will all contribute to a strengthened civil society. The objectives are; Human Rights Objective: Rights holders', grassroots communities', and CSO's capacity strengthened to advocate for a functioning rule of law as well as respect and promotion of Human Rights, which benefits all. Democracy Objective: Rights holders, grassroots communities and CSOs supported to strengthen their capability for widening democratic space in Cambodia, which benefits all. Gender Equality Objective: Women, men and boys and girls empowered and strengthened to exercise their rights for gender equality, hold government accountable to their commitments and contribute to reducing gender-based violence in community and society. Objectives for strengthening partners: Partners are empowered and strengthened to achieve organizational and programmatic sustainability.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

description.narrative: There is no report from 2020 that can verify the results achievements yet. The program has provided core support to key human rights organisations in Cambodia in accordance with the program document and the agreement. Due to the pandemic there has been less opportunities for field visits but one field visit was possible to do in November 2020 which confirmed the relevance and importance of the work of Diakonia and its partners in Cambodia. The field trip was related to land rights and the right to adequate compensation when land have been legally or illegally confiscated by state or private actors.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
